titles.title: Federal Financial Aid Regulatory Relief Act
To eliminate the requirement for students to register with the selective service system in order to receive Federal student financial assistance.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to House Education and the Workforce
Executive Comment Requested from Selective Service Comm.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.
Received unfavorable report from Selective Service System.
Referred to the Subcommittee on 21st Century Competitiveness.

bill.summary: 5/21/2001--Introduced. Federal Financial Aid Regulatory Relief Act - Amends the Military Selective Service Act and the Higher Education Act of 1965 to repeal the requirement that students must register with the selective service system in order to receive Federal student financial aid.
